Ligands¶

  • Ligand properties

Ligand properties¶

class DARTassembler.src.ligand_extraction.Molecule.RCA_Ligand(denticity: int, ligand_to_metal: list, atomic_props: dict, name: str, graph=None, global_props: dict | None = None, other_props={}, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: RCA_Molecule

This class is used to represent ligands in the MetaLig database.

add_additional_molecule_information_to_global_props()¶
add_atom(symbol: str, coordinates: list[float])[source]¶
add_warning(warning)¶
append_to_file(key: str, writer)¶

write the mol object to a file. E.g.: ``` with jsonlines.open(path, mode=’w’) as writer:

mol.write_to_file(key=mol.name, writer=writer)

```

betaH_check(node_label='node_label') → bool[source]¶

Checks if the ligand has beta Hydrogen. Alpha H is ignored. Beta H is defined as a H atom which is exactly two bonds away from a coordinating atom. @return: True if beta Hydrogen is present, False otherwise

calculate_angular_deviation_from_centrosymmetry() → float[source]¶

Calculate the angular deviation from centrosymmetry. Only defined for monodentate ligands. :return: Angular deviation from centrosymmetry for monodentates, np.nan for others.

calculate_planarity() → float¶

Calculates the planarity of the molecule. @return: Planarity of the molecule as a float between 0 and 1. 0 means not planar at all (a sphere), 1 means perfectly planar.

check_bidentate_planarity(tol: bool = 0.7, return_deviation: bool = False) → bool | tuple[bool, float][source]¶

Checks if the ligand is bidentate planar. Only defined for bidentate ligands. @param tol: Maximum tolerance to be considered planar. Default is 0.7. @param return_deviation: If True, the calculated deviation is returned as well @return: True if the ligand is bidentate planar, False otherwise

check_for_bond_order_attribute(bond_label: str = 'bond_type') → bool¶

Checks if the graph has bond orders for all bonds. Note, these bond orders can be unknown to rdkit and therefore be not useful. If you want to test just for good bond orders, use self.check_for_good_bond_orders().

check_for_good_bond_orders() → bool¶

Checks whether the molecular graph has any bond orders that cannot be understood by smiles. @return: True if the molecular graph has any bond orders that cannot be understood by smiles, False otherwise

check_for_neighboring_coordinating_atoms() → bool[source]¶

Checks if any of the coordinating atoms are neighbors. @return: True if two coordinating atoms are neighbors, False otherwise

check_for_unknown_bond_orders() → bool¶

Checks whether the molecular graph has any bond orders that cannot be understood by smiles. @return:

check_if_centrosymmetric(threshold: float = 8, return_ang_dev=False) → bool | tuple[bool, float][source]¶

Check if the ligand is centrosymmetric. Only defined for monodentate ligands. @return: True if the ligand is monodentate and centrosymmetric, False otherwise.

check_if_graph_and_coordinates_are_consistent(node_label='node_label')¶
check_input_inherit_global_properties(inherit_global_properties: list) → list¶

Checks whether inherit_global_properties has correct input format. :param inherit_global_properties: input :return: correctly specified inherit_global_properties

contains_only(atoms: str | list, except_elements: list = []) → bool¶

Returns True if the molecule contains only elements out of the list atoms, otherwise False. @param atoms: list of elements to check for @param except_elements: ignore these elements in the molecule when testing @return:

count_C_H_bonds(node_label='node_label') → int¶

Returns the number of C-H bonds in the molecule. @return: number of C-H bonds in the molecule.

count_atoms_with_n_bonds(element: str | None, n_bonds: int, graph_element_label: str = 'node_label', remember_metal: bool = False) → int[source]¶

Count the number of occurrences of element element with exactly n_bonds bonds. @param element (str, None): specification of the element, e.g. ‘C’. If None, all elements are counted. @param n_bonds (int): count an atom if it has exactly this number of bonds @param graph_element_label (str): the label of the element string in the graph attributes. Only necessary if element is not None. @param remember_metal (bool): If the original bonds to the metal should be considered or not. Only relevant for ligands. @return (int): integer count of the occurrences

count_bond_types(bond_types: list, bond_type_name: str = 'bond_type') → int | float¶

Counts the number of specified bond types in the molecular graph. @param bond_types: list of integers of rdkit bond types @return: True if the molecular graph has any of the specified bond types, False otherwise

count_unknown_bond_orders() → int | float¶

Counts the number of bond orders which are specified as unknown. @return:

functional_atom_check(atoms_of_interest: [<class 'str'>, list[str]] = None)[source]¶
generate_descriptors(get_3D_descriptors: bool = True) → dict[source]¶

Generates descriptors for the ligand. Needs pymatgen and mordred installed.

get_all_inter_atomic_distances_as_list()¶

Returns the distances between all atoms in the molecule. @return: list of distances between all atoms in the molecule

get_ase_molecule(remove_elements: list = [], add_atoms: list = []) → Atoms¶

Get ASE molecule from atomic properties. :param remove_elements: list of elements to remove from the molecule :param add_atoms: list of tuples of the form [(element, (x,y,z))] to add to the returned ase molecule

get_ase_molecule_with_metal(metal: str | None = None) → Atoms[source]¶

Get ASE molecule with metal at original metal location. If no metal is specified, the original metal is used.

get_assembly_dict()[source]¶

only to get the attributes required for the assembly with cians script a little faster :return: {index: list, type: list, xyz_str: str}

get_atomic_distance(mode: str = 'min')[source]¶

Returns the distance of atoms to each other. @param mode: any of [‘min’, ‘max’, ‘coordinating’, ‘all’] @return: Returns the specified distance(s)

get_atomic_distance_to_original_metal(mode: str = 'min')[source]¶

Returns the distance of the ligand from the metal. Can also be used to get the maximum distance of an atom in the ligand to the metal or the distances of all coordinating elements. @param mode: any of [‘min’, ‘max’, ‘coordinating’, ‘all’] @return: Returns the specified distance(s)

get_atomic_distances_between_atoms(skip_elements: str | list = []) → float¶

Returns the minimum, maximum and all distances between two atoms in the molecule. @param skip_elements: Do not include bonds with these elements in the calculation @return: tuple of (minimum, maximum, all) distance of atoms in Angstrom

get_atomic_positions(atomic_indices) → list¶

Returns the atomic positions of the atoms with the given indices.

get_bond_order_graph_hash(element_label='node_label', bond_label='bond_type')¶
get_coordinates_list() → list¶

Returns the coordinates of the ligand without the metal. @return: Coordinates of the ligand without the metal in format [[x1, y1, z1], [x2, y2, z2], …]

get_coordinates_with_metal()[source]¶

Returns the coordinates of the ligand with the metal. @return: Coordinates of the ligand with the metal

get_elements_list() → list¶

Returns a list of the elements in the molecule. :return: list of elements

get_graph_fragments(atom_label='node_label') → tuple[list, list]¶

Returns a list of the fragment indices (unconnected components) and their elements of the molecular graph.

get_graph_hash()¶
get_graph_hash_with_metal(metal_symbol, graph_atom_label: str = 'node_label') → str[source]¶

Returns the graph hash of the ligand including the metal and the bonds to the metal. @return: graph hash

get_graph_with_metal(metal_symbol: str | None = None, return_metal_index: bool = False)[source]¶

Returns the graph of the ligand but with the original metal connected to the coordinating atoms. @return:

get_hash()¶
get_heavy_atoms_graph_hash(element_label='node_label')¶
get_heavy_atoms_graph_hash_with_metal(metal_symbol, graph_atom_label: str = 'node_label') → str[source]¶

Returns the graph hash of the ligand including the metal and the bonds to the metal. Only heavy atoms are considered. @return: graph hash

get_ligand_output_info(max_entries=inf) → dict[source]¶
get_ligand_stats() → dict[source]¶

Returns a dictionary with potentially interesting ligand statistics. @return: Dictionary with stats

get_local_elements() → list[source]¶

Calculates the elements in the first coordination sphere from self.ligand_to_metal. :return: list of elements in first coordination sphere

get_mol_from_input(mol)¶
get_n_protons() → int¶
get_reindexed_graph(node_label='node_label') → Graph¶

Reindex and sort the graph nodes from 0 to n-1 to match the atom order in the atomic_props. Also make a lot of checks to make sure everything is consistent. :return: reindexed graph

get_smiles() → str¶

Returns the SMILES string of the molecule. @return: SMILES string of the molecule.

get_standardized_stoichiometry() → str¶

Returns a string with the stoichiometry in a standardized way. We use the Hill notation, except that for elements with stoichiometry 1 this 1 is written as well. :return: stoichiometry (str)

get_xtb_descriptors()[source]¶

Return xtb descriptors for the molecule. Needs xtb installed.

get_xyz_as_array() → ndarray¶

returns a numpy array of the xyz coordinates. Shape: (n_atoms, 3)

get_xyz_file_format_string(comment: str = '') → str¶

returns a string that can be written into an .xyz file

has_bond_type(bond_types: list, bond_type_name: str = 'bond_type') → bool¶

Checks whether the molecular graph has any of the specified bond types. @param bond_types: list of integers of rdkit bond types @return: True if the molecular graph has any of the specified bond types, False otherwise

has_graph_hash()¶
has_hash()¶
if_same_stoichiometry(other_stoi: str) → bool¶

Checks if the stoichiometry of the molecule is the same as the given stoichiometry. :param other_stoi: stoichiometry to compare to :return: True if the stoichiometry is the same, False otherwise

ligand_naming(denticity: int, ligand_list) -> (<class 'str'>, <class 'str'>)¶
classmethod make_from_atomic_properties(atomic_props_mol: dict, global_props_mol: dict, graph=None, graph_creating_strategy: str = 'default', **kwargs)¶

A more convenient creation method, as in general the atomic properties already imply the information for the ase mol

make_graph(graph_creating_strategy: str, **kwargs)¶

This method also allows to overwrite graphs via the command self.graph = self.make_graph(…) which will set self.graph to the newly created graph

normalize_multigraph_into_graph_inplace()¶

If self.graph is a MultiGraph, it is normalized into a Graph. :return: None

planar_check(eps=2)[source]¶

Checks if the ligand has planar donor atoms. Check is done only for denticity 3 and 4, otherwise False is returned. :param eps: durch try’n’error obtained eps für (d=4) -> 1 :return:

print_to_xyz(path: str)¶
classmethod read_from_mol_dict(dict_: dict, **kwargs)[source]¶

Reads the ligand from a provided dictionary.

remove_node_features_from_molecular_graphs_inplace(keep: list | None = None)¶

Removes all node features from all molecular graphs in the db except the node features specified in keep. :param keep: list of node features which will not be removed :return: None

set_other_props_as_properties(other_props)¶
sort_atomic_props_to_have_coordinating_atoms_first()[source]¶

Sorts the atomic properties such that the atoms that are coordinating are first in the list. Attention: This does not change anything else, only the atomic properties. The graph and the ligand_to_metal are still the same!

to_pymatMol()¶
to_stk_bb()[source]¶

this is really only designed for ligands as a normal RCA_Molecule doesn’t have the required properties

to_stk_mol()¶
validity_check_created_molecule()¶

This method aims to check if the created molecule is valid, i.e. if all its attributes are compatible

view_3d()¶

easy employment of the ase functionality

view_graph(node_label='node_label', node_size=150)¶

simple plot of the molecule as a graph, only connectivity, no distances

write_to_mol_dict(include_graph_dict: bool = True) → dict[source]¶

Graph hash not that important for molecules I guess
